concise_definition: v. 公布, 宣布, 通告

definitions.explanation_en: To make something publicly known, especially through an official or formal statement, often to inform a group or the general public.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过正式或官方的声明使某事为公众所知，通常用于向群体或大众传达重要信息。
definitions.example_en: The president announced a new policy to reduce carbon emissions.
definitions.example_cn: 总统宣布了一项减少碳排放的新政策。

definitions.explanation_en: To declare or state something clearly and loudly, often to attract attention or signal an upcoming event.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指清晰而响亮地声明某事，通常是为了引起注意或预告即将发生的事件。
definitions.example_en: The host announced the winner of the competition over the microphone.
definitions.example_cn: 主持人通过麦克风宣布了比赛的获胜者。

definitions.explanation_en: To indicate or suggest something indirectly, often through subtle signs or context.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过间接的迹象或上下文暗示某事，而非直接声明。
definitions.example_en: The way he avoided eye contact announced his discomfort with the topic.
definitions.example_cn: 他回避眼神接触的方式透露出他对这个话题的不安。

comparison.analysis: “Declare” (宣布) 更强调正式、权威性的公开声明，常用于法律、政治或军事语境，带有更强的决断性和不可逆转性。而 “announce” 更广泛，可用于日常或非正式场合，语气相对中性。
“Proclaim” (宣告) 带有庄严、隆重甚至宣传的色彩，常用于国家、宗教或重大历史事件的公开宣告，语气比 “announce” 更正式、更具仪式感。例如君主宣告登基。
“Notify” (通知) 侧重于向特定个人或群体传递信息，强调信息的送达和接收，通常不强调公开性或广泛传播。而 “announce” 更倾向于面向公众或群体的广泛传播。
